file_content.text: The spread of rakghoul plague on Tatooine has caused the Ministry of Logistics to place Mos Ila Spaceport under null-tolerance lockdown protocols.
Attention: Travel to Tatooine is strictly banned by Imperial edict until the rakghoul outbreak has been contained.
Attention: Travel to Alderaan is strictly banned by Imperial edict until the rakghoul outbreak has been contained.
All trade with the houses of Alderaan, including Thul and Panteer, has been placed on hold until the planet's rakghoul infestation has been suitably contained.
Anyone suspected of illegally traveling from Alderaan is to be scrutinized for signs of rakghoul contamination and, if deemed appropriate, eliminated.
Those willing to risk everything to combat the plague on Alderaan should consult with a representative of the Hyland Organization for Rakghoul Neutralization onworld.
Should the rakghoul problem grow out of hand, the Imperial First Fleet is preauthorized to commence full-scale orbital bombardment of Alderaan.
Anyone suspected of illegally traveling from Tatooine is to be scrutinized for signs of rakghoul contamination and, if deemed appropriate, eliminated.
Those willing to risk everything to combat the plague on Tatooine should consult with a representative of the Hyland Organization for Rakghoul Neutralization onworld.
Should the rakghoul problem grow out of hand, the Imperial First Fleet is preauthorized to commence full-scale orbital bombardment of Tatooine.
If you are infected with the rakghoul plague, please arrange for your immediate incineration.
Remain vigilant during this rakghoul emergency. Use of lethal force against plague carriers is authorized and encouraged.
Per Ministry of Biotic Science guidelines, airlock expulsion has been approved as an acceptable method of rakghoul-plague carrier disposal.
All citizens are required to seek out signs of genetic mutation due to rakghoul-plague exposure, and neutralize the afflicted as necessary.
THORN representatives tending to the rakghoul situation are in need of volunteers. Caution: in volunteering, you place both your life and citizenship at risk.
Attention: Travel to Quesh is strictly banned by Imperial edict until the rakghoul outbreak has been contained.
Anyone suspected of illegally traveling from Quesh is to be scrutinized for signs of rakghoul contamination and, if deemed appropriate, eliminated.
Those willing to risk everything to combat the plague on Quesh should consult with a representative of the Hyland Organization for Rakghoul Neutralization onworld.
Should the rakghoul problem grow out of hand, the Imperial First Fleet is preauthorized to commence full-scale orbital bombardment of Quesh.
Despite rumors to the contrary, rakghouls are fully immune to the toxic atmosphere of Quesh.
Attention: Travel to Corellia is strictly banned by Imperial edict until the rakghoul outbreak has been contained.
Anyone suspected of illegally traveling from Corellia is to be scrutinized for signs of rakghoul contamination and, if deemed appropriate, eliminated.
Those willing to risk everything to combat the plague on Corellia should consult with a representative of the Hyland Organization for Rakghoul Neutralization onworld.
Should the rakghoul problem grow out of hand, the Imperial First Fleet is preauthorized to commence full-scale orbital bombardment of Corellia.
Take note: the rakghoul outbreak poses more of a threat to Imperial interests on Corellia than those of the Republic.
